name: Sun Pacific
notes: 600,000 sq ft packing facility. Ships 70M+ boxes annually from 30,000 acres. Brands: Cuties, Mighties, Air Chief. Sales office in Pasadena.

name: Wonderful Citrus Packing LLC
source: Wonderful Citrus website - USDA NOP certified
notes: America's largest integrated citrus grower/packer/shipper. World's largest citrus packinghouse (size of 7 football fields). Processes 26M+ cartons annually. Additional facility at 1701 S Lexington St. Brand: Halos mandarins.

name: Grimmway Farms Inc.
notes: Headquarters in Bakersfield. One of world's largest carrot producers. 60,000+ acres under cultivation, 50,000+ acres organic. 19 facilities total across CA, CO, FL, GA, NV, OR, WA.

name: Church Brothers Farms
address: 19065 Portola Drive, Suite C, Salinas, CA 93908
notes: Founded 1999. Vertically integrated grower-processor. State-of-the-art processing plant (True Leaf Farms). Acquired Mann Packing Dec 2025 including 200,000 sq ft Gonzales facility.

name: Tanimura & Antle Corporation
notes: Largest independent lettuce grower/distributor in US. 40,000+ acres in CA/AZ. Founded 1982. Packing facility in Spreckels, CA. Additional 14-acre hydroponic greenhouse in Livingston, TN.

name: Mann Packing (acquired by Church Brothers 2025, formerly Fresh Del Monte)
source: Fresh Del Monte / Church Brothers acquisition news
notes: 5 facilities across CA. 200,000 sq ft fully automated Gonzales facility (2021). 160,000 sq ft production/cold storage, 40,000 sq ft offices. Acquired by Church Brothers Dec 2025.

name: Washington Fruit Growers
notes: Family-owned since 1916. Growing, packing, shipping. Second state-of-the-art cherry packing line at Washington Fruit & Produce campus (2025). Organic certified.

name: Starr Ranch Growers
notes: Founded 1934 in Washington's apple country. Leading fruit grower, packer, shipper of Northwest-grown fruit.

name: Gebbers Farms
notes: Largest provider of cherries in the world. Top apple grower in Northwestern US. 100% family owned and managed. Granny Smith, Fuji, Gala, Red Delicious, Golden Delicious.

name: CMI Orchards
notes: One of WA's largest grower, packer, shipper. #1 selling brands in US: CMI Orchards and Daisy Girl Organics.

name: Apple King
notes: Family-owned since 1914 (100+ years). Conventional and organic fruit packer in Yakima Valley.

name: Oregon Berry Packing, Inc.
address: 6000 SW Minter Bridge Rd, Hillsboro, OR 97123
source: Oregon Berry Packing website - ODA Korea Export Program
notes: Founded 1948. Family-owned, 70+ years experience. Certified Organic, FDA registration (FDA3010063). Supplies buyers worldwide.

name: Naumes, Inc.
notes: One of largest family-owned pear growers in US. Home office in Medford handles marketing/sales for OR, WA, CA. Started as WWII veteran packing house. Varieties: Anjou, Bosc, Comice.

name: Rio Fresh, Inc.
notes: Founded 1970. One of oldest family farming/packing operations in Rio Grande Valley. Primus-GFS certified packing facility on-farm. GAP certified, PrimusGFS audited.

name: Growers Select Produce Inc.
notes: Founded 1987 by Bob Dyer. Rio Grande Valley native. Third-party certified farms and packing facilities. Family-owned and operated.

name: Lone Star Citrus Growers
notes: Last independent, family-owned TX citrus packing house. Rio Red grapefruit (75% of crop), Marr's early sweet oranges, navels, pineapples, Valencia oranges. Ships Oct-April.

name: J&D Produce
notes: One of Texas' largest fresh vegetable growers. Large packing and shipping facility. Thousands of acres throughout lower Rio Grande Valley.

name: Frontera Produce
notes: Grower, shipper, packer. Specializes in Rio Grande Valley produce and imports from Mexico. Focus on locally produced onions and imported chiles.

name: Pearson Farm
notes: Converted old Zenith Consolidated School into modern peach packing facility (1975). Self-guided tours of peach packing facility during summer season. Year-round pecans.

name: Lane Southern Orchards
notes: 6,000 acres of pecan orchards. Spreading taste of Georgia since 1908.

name: South Georgia Pecan Company
notes: Founded 1913 as small pecan shelling plant by Pearlman family. Owned by Worn Family since 2015. Expanded Eastern Production Facility plus El Paso, TX facility.

name: Sunnyland Farms
notes: 1,700-acre pecan farm purchased by Will Willson in 1928. Kosher certified (Atlanta Kashruth Commission): Mammoth/Junior Halves, Large/Small Pieces.

name: Farm Pak / Barnes Farming
notes: Facilities in Spring Hope and Benson, NC. Multiple storage facilities in eastern NC. 4 packing lines. 20 truckloads refrigeration capacity. 2M bushel temperature-controlled storage. One of most modern vegetable packing firms in US.

name: Boyette Brothers Produce
notes: Sweet potato packing house with 3 loading docks. 2 dedicated packing lines (stainless steel and organic). Operates 6 days/week. One of first NC sweet potato pack houses with stainless steel line.

name: Scott Farms
notes: 60,000 sq ft packing and shipping facility opened 2015. Sizes potatoes and packages to retailer/restaurant/foodservice preferences for each country.

name: Millstream Farms
notes: Grower, packer, shipper of NC sweet potatoes. Owned and managed by Chancy family in eastern NC.

name: B & B Produce
notes: Locally family-owned grower, packer, shipper. Serves wholesale, retail, foodservice, processing markets. USDA Harmonized GAP, Global GAP, GRASP certified.

name: Riveridge Produce Marketing
notes: Received $100K MDARD grant for weigher/batcher on cherry packing line in Grant, MI. Creates efficiencies for more accurate weight packing.

name: A.L. Johnson & Sons, Inc.
notes: Received $100K MDARD grant for packing/sorting equipment and second packing line in Leroy, MI facility. Generates 6 full-time jobs.

name: Driscoll's, Inc.
notes: Headquarters and R&D in Watsonville. 56 cooling/distribution sites in North/South America. Hand-picked and field-packed (except some blueberries). Santa Maria distribution facility. Operations on 5 continents, 115,000+ farm workers.

name: Fresh Del Monte Produce Inc.
source: Fresh Del Monte website - multiple states
notes: Vertically integrated global producer. 34 facilities in North America. Tricont Trucking/Logistics network. 13 owned vessels. Acquired Mann Packing 2018 (sold to Church Brothers 2025).
